intro: Omalotheca norvegica, commonly known as the Norwegian thimbleweed, is a perennial herb native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Omalotheca norvegica is often found in temperate regions and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
